The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with a lot of extra pillows in the cabinet. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with any questions or requests I had. They went above and beyond to ensure that I had a pleasant stay. The location of this transient house was also ideal, with easy access to nearby shops, Marketplace in San Juan near plaza. There are nearby shops in case you need to buy something. Take note that the location of this hostel is a 30-minute walk from San Juan beach if you don't have a private transport. Public transportation is very convenient in the morning but at night, you really need to take tricycle rides. Our experience with my siblings at this transient house exceeded all my expectations. I would highly recommend it to big groups looking for a comfortable, welcoming, and convenient place to stay. I can't wait to return for another visit in the future.

Contents:
Dive Union: San Juan, La Union Dives
Thank you to Richard of Kahuna Beach Resort & Spa and Dive Union for showing me some of the best dive spots in San Juan, La Union!
We did a couple of dives at Fagg Reef and Coral Garden. Fagg Reef is an advanced dive, where you can see schooling fish and lots of eels. It's a bit of a drift dive, and currents can change suddenly. Coral Garden is an easy dive. Saw the star of our dives there: a show-offy mantis shrimp.
translated_content:
Dive Union: San Juan, La Union Dives
Thank you to Richard of Kahuna Beach Resort & Spa and Dive Union for showing me some of the best dive spots in San Juan, La Union!
We did a couple of dives at Fagg Reef and Coral Garden. Fagg Reef is an advanced dive, where you can see schooling fish and lots of eels. It's a bit of a drift dive, and currents can change suddenly. Coral Garden is an easy dive. Saw the star of our dives there: a show-offy mantis shrimp.

Contents:
Thank you, TenEleven! This is an underrated place. It maybe on the residential side of La Uniion when you see it on the map but the beach, especially Kabsat can be a 5 MIN WALKING distance and the bus stop is so near if you are commuter. The room is so clean with fast wifi and aircon. Even, power outlets!   The owner and the caretaker are hospitable offering  3 in 1 coffee anytime and pandesal in the morning. They have water dispenser. There are also shower rooms and toilet room separately with toiletries. all in all, we are very satisfied, wfh, commuter friendly(parking is also available for those who have cars) 
 Highly recommended .

Contents:
I have stayed in a couple of places in LU and almost all the hostels. No doubt this is the best. Stayed in this place for 5 days, i had a really awesome experience. 

The location is great. A short walk to the restaurants, highway and beach. Staff was impressive. They were very accommodating and friendly. Their service was really good! I never for once in the whole week see them frown or not smile. All my concerns were always met and they were always happy to help guests with their concerns. I also would like to mention the owners of the hostel, Buji and Nikki. In my experience they are the nicest and best hosts in a hostel. They are very humble and wonderful hosts. 

You will never really feel crowded in this hostel since there are 22 beds overall. I like hostels like this since usually service is better at this number. The rooms are really nice. Its not a basic room. Its simple yet well designed rooms. Sometimes i really feel like i just want to hang out in the room because it's very cozy inside. There are a lot of space for people in the room to put their things. Rooms are all equipped with A/C, perfect for the Philippines as it could be very warm sometimes. Towels and blankets that were provided smelled really good and were clean. All the common areas, toilets, and showers were ALWAYS clean. Also all the tissues, and Body wash were always filled. The hostel also provide an outdoor shower for people coming from the beach or from people coming from surfing. Also a surf rack if guests do bring their boards.

Lastly would like to mention the Roof deck. I love hanging out in that place. It's very chill to hang out there. Great place to meet other guests in the hostel! Oh and there is a Kitchen and Fridge in the roof deck for guests who would want to cook their own food or put some stuff on the fridge. It is also a great place to study and work. There were a couple of guests that i met who were there working in the roof deck. 

Really Good Hostel. The best Hostel in LU and I think in all of the Philippines in my experience. Good Job Guys!

Its not a basic room. Its simple yet well designed rooms. Sometimes I really feel like I just want to hang out in the room because it's very cozy inside. There are a lot of spaces for people in the room to put their things. Rooms are all equipped with A/C, perfect for the Philippines as it could be very warm sometimes. Contents: Great food and excellent service! Everything was fresh from the meats and seafoods to the veggies. We were first customers for dinner so they just started cooking rice. The waitress was courteous enough to tell us that it may take 40 minutes. So we ordered 2 appetizers to while away the time. The waitress was so proactive to divide the appetizers into 2 sets since were occupying 2 couch tables. Then she also divided the pinakbet into 2 serving plates. All done with a smile and courtesy worthy of a good family restaurant, which was just about right for us since my kids were with me. But hey It is a bar with an acoustic band!

Contents: First time to visit Elyu and found this place to stay as I've seen my friend's post na dito sila ng stay and she recommended this also, lalo na pag gusto mo yung hindi crowded ung place at malapit lang sa beach. Me and my husband stayed in kubo and we highly recommended to stay here if couple kayo, their kubo has an aircon and spaces for your bags, plus pwede ka tumambay at magmuni muni lang sa labas na merong lamesa.  Very accomodating pa sila ate at Joy, as well as the owner, dahil pinayagan na kami mag check-in ng mas maaga dahil maaga kami nakarating (plus factor to kasi di pa kami natutulog since maaga kami gumayak para mag commute). Originally, dapat April pa ung unang booking namin to celebrate our second Wedding Anniversary, but due to some personal reasons, it was rescheduled on May 5-6, buti nalang may nakasalo ng initial booking namin. Thanks G! Thank you, Solana  God bless po

Sister and Joy are very accomodating, as well as the owner, because they allowed us to check-in earlier because we arrived early (plus factor because we haven't slept yet since we got dressed early to commute). Originally, our first booking was supposed to be in April to celebrate our second Wedding Anniversary, but due to some personal reasons, it was rescheduled on May 5-6, fortunately someone caught our initial booking. Thanks G! Thank you, Solana God bless you

Place is quiet and peaceful, and only a few minutesÆ drive away from the beach. They accommodate walk in guests; 7am to 9pm (8pm last order). Curo has two dining areas to select from ù an al fresco for the fresh air to breeze in; and an air-conditioned spaced.  They offer a wide selection of food choices for any time of the day. Budget per person is around P400 to P800, but super sulit. Their drinks and dish offers great value for money! Curo also offers vegan and vegetarian options!

Contents: Been to Elyu several times but this is the first time we tried a different accommodation, and seriously - one of the best decisions we made while in Elyu. Rates are cheap compared to others, location is in the middle so it's just walking distance to places like 7-Eleven, Tavern, and Flotsam, rooms are okay especially if you just need a place to stay then the aircon is cold, the cr is clean, and the water flow is strong, but above all the owners are very accomodating. It's still very kind. The free water and coffee downstairs is just a bonus. Will definitely consider staying here again and will recommend to friends as well. See you next time!

Contents: My friends and I had a great and comfortable stay at Villa Vianer transient. Pagdating namin sa San Juan, sinundo pa nila kami from our drop-off. The rooms are air-conditioned, and may 4 toilet cubicles. They even allowed us to check in early kasi maaga kami dumating from Manila. The next day, we wanted to go to Tangadan falls (San Gabriel), pinayagan nila kami iwan ang mga gamit namin sa room kahit check-out na kami. Hinatid pa nila kami papunta sa San Gabriel. Super bait ng mga may-ari (Ma'am Nena). Reasonable price as well. May free breakfast pa (milo, coffee, sandwich). 100% recommend!
translated_content: My friends and I had a great and comfortable stay at Villa Vianer transient. When we arrived in San Juan, they even picked us up from our drop-off. The rooms are air-conditioned, and have 4 toilet cubicles. They even allowed us to check in early because we arrived early from Manila. The next day, we wanted to go to Tangadan falls (San Gabriel), they allowed us to leave our things in the room even after we checked out. They even drove us to San Gabriel. The owners (Ma'am Nena) are super kind. Reasonable price as well. There is also a free breakfast (milo, coffee, sandwiches). 100% recommended!

Contents: Okaeri totally blew us away as a laidback spot to escape in the busiest town of Elyu. Our experience is nothing short of spectacular. The host, Sir Michael and the staff were very welcoming, adding that extra touch to make us feel right at home. Their cabins exude warmth and comfort, spotlessly clean, comfy beds, blankies and pillows. sleeping in the loft felt so cozy too. Atchitectural design is very aesthetic and picturesque, Interior design is superb, and stylishly decorated and amenities are fully equipped which made our life easy. We loved the overall aesthetic of the cabin. Swimming pool is heated, very kid friendly and with jacuzzi too! Even water in the bidet, shower and the faucets are heated. No available food but sir Mike recommended a food delivery which is very satisfying too, ate in their porch which makes it feel more cozy!

Contents:
Recommending this resort ONLY because the Security Guard and staff were warm and helpful.  The beachfront location is good too but there are corals on the shore so still had to walk about 5-8 minutes to get to a good swimming spot for the kids.
Unfortunately, the rooms were a total disappointment.  The rooms were rundown, bathroom was not cleaned at all (there was even sachets of shampoo left), cracked floor tiles, wardrobes were dirty, air conditioner was dripping, water from the sink and shower is salty and water was very weak, It is almost not working from the second floor.  
Could see that the resort was definitely nice before but it has been neglected already and definitely needs some much needed maintenance.
I will not be staying in this place again nor would be recommending this to my friends.

Contents: The place is beautiful. Di ko na need iedit ung photos para pagandahin ung lugar. If you are looking for a good place to stay with spacious common areas and rooms for more than a day, this is the place you are looking for. Ang babait pa ng owners and locals. Less than 10 minutes drive/tricycle ride to the public beach and the main road.  Pwede rin mag hold ng event sa place na to. Please note that ung kitchen and 2 bathrooms (isa sa loob ng main hous and isa sa labas) sa main house ay shared, pero maayos and malinis palagi. Pwede rin mag luto dito if you have the time. Medyo new sila kaya baka di ganon ka popular pero madali mai-google sa google maps. May free internet, air conditioned rooms, common area TV, refrigerator. They also offer drinking water for a fair price kaya kung nakalimutan nyo mag dala ayos lang. Very spacious and relaxing garden. If youÆre lucky na may bunga ung mulberry and guava tree nila, pwede nyo pa gawin snack. Solid stay namin for vacation. Very happy with the experience here.
translated_content: The place is beautiful. I don't need to edit the photos to beautify the place. If you are looking for a good place to stay with spacious common areas and rooms for more than a day, this is the place you are looking for. The kindness of the owners and locals. Less than 10 minutes drive/tricycle ride to the public beach and the main road.  You can also hold an event at this place. Please note that the kitchen and 2 bathrooms (one inside the main house and one outside) in the main house are shared, but always neat and clean. You can also cook here if you have the time. They are relatively new so they may not be that popular but they are easy to google on google maps. There is free internet, air conditioned rooms, common area TV, refrigerator. They also offer drinking water for a fair price so if you forget to bring it, it's fine. Very spacious and relaxing garden. If you're lucky that their mulberry and guava trees have fruit, you can even make them a snack. We had a solid stay for vacation. Very happy with the experience here.

Contents: On Day 1 (Saturday), we left Manila around 4 am and arrived at HADS exactly at 2 pm, just in time for check-in (despite the rain). Our host even went out to pick us up outside because we were getting lost. They had a gallon of mineral water ready for us, and it was given to us for free! We didn't have any cups, but they kindly lent us theirs. Around 4 pm, we were ready to head to Flotsam to secure a table since we expected it to be crowded. However, due to the heavy rain, we couldn't go out and catch a tricycle. So our host decided to escort us to Flotsam using their large van! We received VIP treatment even though the cost was incredibly affordable. What more could you ask for? When we arrived at Flotsam, we invited our host to join us for drinks as a way of saying thank you. As expected, all the tables were taken and reserved. Fortunately, our host was there and used their influence to secure a table for us with a shelter! It was truly amazing!

Contents: The place was beyond our expectations! The size of the cabin is enough for 2 pax plus luggages. Even common cr, they are making sure that once in a while it is really cleaned. The water pressure is strong. Also plus points to be able to use their kitchen. It's a big savings compared if you eat out which can cost you around 150-300 per meal and then the serving is not that much. Spacious parking space and approachable staff! If there is still a need to improve, maybe just maintain the plants to make them look better. The place will be even more beautiful if you add bougainvillea plants. And to promote the place more, they could have put signage outside and stickers on the tricycles. Hoping to come back again!

Contents: They should change their name to Ocenaire Glamping Paradise. Their place is a paradise not more than 5mins from the main road but still very peaceful esp at night, talk about perfect location! It was a spontaneous trip coming from Manila, and I was able to book a tent for an overnight stay instantly. Arrived at 8pm and staff weÆre very accommodating, they set up my tent, table and chairs by the beach ù expect musical ocean waves perfect for the soul. I booked for 2 more nights in their air-conditioned kubo ù a very comfortable kubo with a big-ass bed that can fit upto 4 pax and a dining / sala outside your room where you can eat, drink and just basically chill. LetÆs talk about food ù definitely a bang for the buck! From their silog meals to snacks to their ala-carte dishes. The ateÆs are always there to assist you with your order and deliver it to your cabin, def a great service! They are very friendly too! Facility wise, pools are I think cleaned everyday because ive been swimming day and night and water is always clear. There is an open-area where you can charge your gadgets if youÆll avail their tent accommodation. Restroom and Bathroom are common but seperate for male and female are always cleaned by their staff, I am very particular for TandB but was able to use their facilities perfectly fine. The resort staff was one of the most friendliest people IÆve ever met, even compared to 3-5 stars hotels and resorts ive been. They always check on me knowing I traveled alone and cater to things I need. I will definitely go back to oceanaire, not just for the view and facilities which is perfect but more for the staff. If you want to re-charge your soul, this is the perfect place for you. Thank you ateÆs and kuya for making me feel safe and at home. See you again!

Contents: HONEST FEEDBACK FROM OUR 4-DAYS STAY IN QUERENCIA ELYU. Cleanliness: The room we found was clean. As in. It's the size of CR and they have free handsoap and tissue. Comfort: The ambiance is really great. Beds & blankets are also okay. The room goods are still comfortable for 6-7 pax. Communication: Ma'am Kristine is really an asset for this business. Good to talk to. If we needed something, he provided. We even ask for discount since on our 4th day, we will leave early because we will go straight to Baguio. They cannot give discount since it is fully paid and I understand their policies but on the other hand, she offered that they will only pay our 2 days parking fee for pay parking and also the cooking/gas fee is free of charge. Safety: Transient is equipped with necessary safety features such as CCTV and fire extinguishers. Feedback: We had a great stay for 3 days and had a 1 day bad experience. Our car was already parked within the transient area on the 3rd night because it was first come first serve. Only limited parking for 2 cars. So when their parking lot became vacant, my boyfriend asked if he could move. Maam Kristine's father agreed, so she was transferred.

Contents:
When we checked in, the only staff present was 1 room lady and 1 security guard, but the place was fully booked. Our room had no floor rugs  the tiles were so cold and started to get all dirty and sandy. The toilet in our room  everything was all kalawang, no flush in the toilet, poor water. The resort would've looked better if not neglected. The tables for eating outside were dirty and with trash on the floors as well. The pool needed cleaning, the next day it had chlorine but wasnt fully cleaned so hindi na swimmable. 

good job to kuya guard and ate na nagiisang staff on duty, they were very warm and helpful.
translated_content:
When we checked in, the only staff present was 1 room lady and 1 security guard, but the place was fully booked. Our room had no floor rugs the tiles were so cold and started to get all dirty and sandy. The toilet in our room everything was all rusty, no flush in the toilet, poor water. The resort would've looked better if not neglected. The tables for eating outside were dirty and with trash on the floors as well. The pool needed cleaning, the next day it had chlorine but wasn't fully cleaned so it was no longer swimmable. 

good job to kuya guard and sister who were the only staff on duty, they were very warm and helpful.

Contents:
Ang alam kasi namin Pet Friendly ang Resort na to,ung isang owner ang bait kausap kasi nakita nya ang Pomeranian dog namin ay napakabait at train,so sa kanya pumayag sya na kasama nmin sa dorm ang dog namin,ung isang owner ang daming kundisyon gusto kulong pa namin sa Cage ang aso kung ikaw ay Pet lover at mahal na mahal mo ang alaga mo ang sakit na makita mo ang aso mo na nakakulong sa Cage.
P1,390 ang rate nila sa bawat Single Bed,pero ginawang 1,190 per single Bed ang ginamit namin tatlong Bed lang,sinisingil kami ng 4 na Bed pati Breakfast, eh hindi namn kami ngbreakfast at tatlo lang ang ginamit namin na Bed,
Staff walang kwenta, ibang-iba sa mga Resort na Napuntahan namin,
Ung isang Owner na lalaki Saludo kami sayo Sir napaka-approchable mo dahil sayo kaya kami nag-Stay dyan sa Urbiz.
Pero kung babalikan mas marami at mas magandang Beach Resort at Mabait na owner at mabait na Staff ang La Union.
Im Sorrry,ang place maganda at Relaxing sa twing pupunta kami ng La Union itong Urbiz Garden talaga ang pinupuntahan namin kasi So Relaxing talaga ang place ang Ambience.
Nalunkot lang ako sa Staff at isang Owner.
Be Nice nalang sa mga dumarating na turista kasi ang gusto namin talaga mgrelaks at hindi ma-stress.
translated_content:
We know that this Resort is Pet Friendly, the owner is nice to talk to because he saw our Pomeranian dog is very kind and trained, so he agreed to let our dog stay with us in the dorm, the owner has many conditions. We even keep the dog in a cage if you are a pet lover and you love your pet very much, it is painful to see your dog in a cage.
Their rate is P1,390 for each single bed, but they changed it to 1,190 per single bed as we only used three beds, they charged us for 4 beds including breakfast, well we didn't have breakfast and we only used three beds,
Staff useless, very different from the Resorts We've Been to,
A male Owner, we salute you Sir, you are very approachable because of you, that's why we stayed there at Urbiz.
But looking back, La Union has more and better Beach Resorts and kind owners and kind Staff.
Im Sorrry, the place is beautiful and Relaxing when we go to La Union, this Urbiz Garden is the one we go to because the Ambience is really Relaxing.
I'm just sorry for the Staff and an Owner.
Just be nice to the tourists who come because we really want to relax and not be stressed.
cleaned_data: know resort pet friendly owner nice talk saw pomeranian dog kind trained agreed let dog stay u dorm owner many condition even keep dog cage pet lover love pet much painful see dog cage rate p1390 single bed changed 1190 per single bed used three bed charged u 4 bed including breakfast well didnt breakfast used three bed staff useless different resort weve male owner salute sir approachable thats stayed urbiz looking back la union better beach resort kind owner kind staff im sorrry place beautiful relaxing go la union urbiz garden one go ambience really relaxing im sorry staff owner nice tourist come really want relax stressed

Contents: We stayed here in Little Surfmaid resort for 3 days and 2 nights and I can say that it was a good one. The location is perfect since it's in the middle of everything (you go right to secure sunset/swimming spots near flotsam jetsam and you go left to eat in several restaurants near San Juan Surf hotel, etc.) Unlike in other hotels, they have their own big parking area so it was very convenient for us and we're at ease that it's inside their premises. Check-in and check-out were quick as well. The room is good for its price but their best asset is their staff. All the staff were nice and friendly, especially kuya from the restaurant. Other staff (reception and cleaners) would also greet you everytime. Overall, we had a great stay here and we'll definitely come back.

Check-in and check-out were quick as well. The room is good for its price but their best asset is their staff. All the staff were nice and friendly, especially kuya from the restaurant. Other staff (reception and cleaners) would also greet you every time. Overall, we had a great stay here and we'll definitely come back.

Contents:
The staffs are friendly and very accommodating. The food serving is decent and reasonable for its price. 

However, upon booking we originally asked for a queen sized bed and a bunk bed so after we made a down payment they told us that the room we asked for is unavailable and the available room is only two bunk beds so good thing IÆm traveling with friends so we can just adjust. I just could not imagine if someone travels with family, a partner and kids perhaps. The room that we got only had two outlets for charging and It is located at the upper bunk bed which is not well thought out electrical planning. The WiFi inside our room is weak and is only accessible outside our door so you if youÆre planning to rest all day while binge watching a show on YouTube or Netflix it wouldnÆt be possible. In our case, my friend works as a VA and the other one is also a student who have to do some important meetings and we have to stay in their restaurant/breakfast area so we can connect to a stronger internet connection. There was an unannounced power outage during our stay and it so happened in the midst of us eating dinner. We were in a middle of a boodle fight and we were provided by a candle light. They donÆt have an electric generator for a back up in case unexpected things like this happen. We went outside to look for cafeÆs since my friend still has to start her shift in a few hours and good thing the power came back just before she clocked in at work.

Overall, It is 2/5 stars for me and my friends just because I was hoping that they should up their game knowing theyÆre still starting their business.

Contents: We stayed for two nights and there were four of us yet they only gave us one key unlike most hotels that usually give two. ThatÆs just one of the reasons why I donÆt recommend them. The main reason is their security which is the most important service any hotels or resorts should offer their customers. On our last night, around 3AM, we were woken up by two girls laughing. We were already sleeping then so we werenÆt really able to react fast. We sat up after they had already left the room. We were thinking that It is either they were given our room key, or they mistakenly used their own key to our room door and it worked which is a huge problem for security! Aniyone couldÆve entered our room and we are all females. That was such a scary experience for all of us. We told the front desk the following morning and she did noteven apologize, she just said, ôAh, baka namali lang po ng pasok. Sabihan ko nalang po æyung naka-duty kagabi
translated_content: We stayed for two nights and there were four of us yet they only gave us one key unlike most hotels that usually give two. That's just one of the reasons why I don't recommend them. The main reason is their security which is the most important service any hotels or resorts should offer their customers. On our last night, around 3AM, we were woken up by two girls laughing. We were already sleeping then so we weren't really able to react fast. We sat up after they had already left the room. We were thinking that It is either they were given our room key, or they mistakenly used their own key to our room door and it worked which is a huge problem for security! Anyone could have entered our room and we are all females. That was such a scary experience for all of us. We told the front desk the following morning and she didn't even apologize, she just said, ôAh, maybe I just made a mistake in entering. I'll just tell the one who was on duty last night

Contents:
DISMAYED. UNCOMFORTABLE. UNWELCOME.
THE PLACE WAS SUPERSEDED BY THE UNWELCOME ACTS OF OWNER!
We were there with my friends and were just few minutes in after check-in last 8-9 April 2023 when the owner entered our room and told us to COUNT-OFF. As a guest/tourist, instead of hearing WELCOME TO QUERENCIA. you were instructed to count-off. She continued her tirade on us and one by one she told us their rules, which I think we already know even before we get there. We do not know her reasons on why she acted like that. WE DID NOT EXPECTED THIS FROM LA UNION. Ilocanos are friendly/welcoming as I have friends who came from this region in the Philippines. We just hope that our experience from this place will be the last and hopefully will not be repeated to their guests in the future.
P.S. The restrooms has no exhaust nor small window for air to circulate or expel off bad odor (bio). Where else will this bad odor will go? - Inside the room. ????
Cooking area/equipment is also limited/not compared to the number of rooms they have.
translated_content:
DISMAYED. UNCOMFORTABLE. WELCOME.
THE PLACE WAS SUPERSEDED BY THE UNWELCOME ACTS OF OWNER!
We were there with my friends and were just a few minutes in after check-in last 8-9 April 2023 when the owner entered our room and told us to COUNT-OFF. As a guest/tourist, instead of hearing WELCOME TO QUERENCIA. you were instructed to count-off. She continued her tirade on us and one by one she told us their rules, which I think we already know even before we get there. We do not know her reasons on why she acted like that. WE DID NOT EXPECT THIS FROM LA UNION. Ilocanos are friendly/welcoming as I have friends who came from this region in the Philippines. We just hope that our experience from this place will be the last and hopefully will not be repeated to their guests in the future.
P.S. The restrooms have no exhaust nor small window for air to circulate or expel off bad odor (bio). Where else will this bad odor go? - Inside the room. ????
Cooking area/equipment is also limited/not compared to the number of rooms they have.

Contents:
When you do not honour the deal (despite having reservation fee paid), the guests have every right to leave your premise and cancel transaction with you. You have no right to impose or make us adjust to your terms just because you want to.
After saying na "umalis nalang sila kung ayaw nila" manunugod kayo sa transient house na nag accommodate sa amin to confront us.
And sa matanda, for you to say na mahiya naman kami dahil we asked you to say SORRY sa taong minura mo, dinuro duro mo, at sinigawan mo, dahil lang sa ikaw ang nakatatanda. Kahit pa ikaw ang pinakamantanda sa mundo, kung ikaw ang mali, ikaw ang dapat magsorry.  You do not deserve any kind of respect from any of us for all the things you have said and have done.

When you do not honor the deal (despite having reservation fee paid), the guests have every right to leave your premise and cancel the transaction with you. You have no right to impose or make us adjust to your terms just because you want to.

And to the elderly, for you to say that we are ashamed because we asked you to say SORRY to the person you insulted, pointed at, and yelled at, just because you are the elder. You do not deserve any kind of respect from any of us for all the things you have said and done.

Contents: Bad experience last april 7! We are walk in only.Pagpasok palang namin nagask na kami sa security kung may avail pang cottages(kasi kung wala namn di na kami papasok) si kuyabg guard nagradio nagask kung may avail pang cottage nagresponse ayun may avail nga daw nagiisa na lang daw so si kuyang guard nagradio uli na ireserved na yung nagiisang cottage na yun.edi kami pasok na park na dalawnag kotse kami ehhh si kuyabg security sinigil agad kami ng parking fee 100 per car.so nagabayd namn kami ayun sbi don na lang daw kami magbayad sa loob ng cottage. First,wlaang nagassist samin papasok kung san magbabayad,first time namin ehhh malay ba namin kung san ang bayaran hinanap pa namin so mejo natagalan.  ayun ng nagtanong kami kung saan yung bayaran which is yun pala ung bayaran ng cottages may isang nagbbayaad na na guest sa nagiisang natirang cottage. So ako mejo natriggered nako niradio ni kuyangsecurity na ireserve dba?! Bkit ibbgay sa iba?Ang amin lang bakit nagappasok pa ng ibang guest kungsa pagpasok palang sa guard sinasabi na kung may available pang cottages o wala na.then binigay pa sa iba ung cottage nakakagigil!!! Ni hindi man lang nagaplogize o wala amn lang akong narinig na sorry sa kanila di na makakaulit saniyo!!!
translated_content: Bad experience last April 7! We are walk in only. As soon as we entered, we asked the security if there were any more cottages available (because if there weren't any, we wouldn't go in) the guard radioed and asked if there were any more cottages available, and he responded that there were still available, so he just left alone. The guard radioed again that the only cottage had been reserved. We entered the park with a yellow car, and the security immediately charged us a parking fee of 100 per car. inside the cottage. First, no one assisted us in going in to pay, it was our first time, did we even know where to pay, so it took a while.  When we asked where the payment was, which is the payment for the cottages, there was a guest who had already paid for the only remaining cottage. So I was triggered by kuyangsecurity to be reserved dba?! Why do you care about others? It's just us, why are other guests allowed in when entering the guard is told if there are more cottages available or not. Then the cottage is given to others, it's terrifying!!! I didn't even log in or hear anything, I'm sorry to them, I can't do it again!!!
cleaned_data: bad experience last april 7 walk soon entered asked security cottage available werent wouldnt go guard radioed asked cottage available responded still available left alone guard radioed cottage reserved entered park yellow car security immediately charged u parking fee 100 per car inside cottage first one assisted u going pay first time even know pay took asked payment payment cottage guest already paid remaining cottage triggered kuyangsecurity reserved dba care others u guest allowed entering guard told cottage available cottage given others terrifying didnt even log hear anything im sorry cant

Contents:
Not a safe place to stay.  Nanakaw ang cp ng anak ko sa mismong loob ng room namin room (M4)  habang tulog kaming lahat. Buti nalang isang cellphone lang nakuha siguro kung ano lang una nyang nadampot since chinacharge ang cp ng anak ko.  Very disappointed. No solution or option na maresolba ang ganitong pangyayari kahit yung mismong may ari pa ang nakausap namin. Pinacheck namin sa cctv pero natatakpan daw ng sasakyan kaya walang makikita na ibang tao na naglakad o pumasok sa room. Yun lang ang sabi pero yung kahit konting pampalubag loob or salita na makakagaan samin. WALA as in WALA charge to experience daw!  Ay ang galing.  Kaya NEVER EVER Book in this Hostel.  
Negative 1M and rate niyo samin!  Never recommended!!!!!
translated_content:
Not a safe place to stay.  My son's cp stole right inside our room (M4) while we were all asleep. It's a good thing he only got one cell phone, maybe it was just what he grabbed first since my son's cp was charged.  Very disappointed. There is no solution or option to resolve this kind of incident even though we have talked to the owner himself. We checked on the cctv but they said it was covered by a car so no one else walked or entered the room. That's all he said, but even a little consolation or word that can make us feel better. NO as in NO charge to experience!  It's great.  So NEVER EVER Book in this Hostel.  
Negative 1M and rate us!  Never recommended!!!!!

Contents: We love Querencia Elyu! It's a family-run business, and they make their guests feel like family as well.  We're a really big group staying for an Ultimate (Frisbee) tournament over the Labor Day weekend. From the moment we were parking our cars, Tito Mar and Tita Eden made it a point that we were comfortable during our stay.  The place offers cooking tools and equipment for free, so we were able to save much on food. The WiFi is stable, allowing us to still catch up on school/work stuff even when we're out of town. We also loved the outdoor shower so we could wash off the sand and enter the rooms as clean as possible.  All the owners and staff were attentive, courteous, and really friendly! We highly recommend Querencia Elyu, and we look forward to returning

Contents: Hi, just wanna share our story dito sa Elyu Bakasyunan, 3 days before ng lakad namin we booked bahay kubo for 2 nights dahil yun nalang available that time, maganda po yung place, may own parking, tahimik and mababait naman po sila ate, nag check-in po kami around 7pm then nag settle ng balance, late na dahil galing pa po kami ng manila, first night namin sobrang tahimik po talaga ng place na parang kami lang yung tao, hanggang sa hindi kami makatulog kasi iba po yung feeling namin, ang creepy, di po kami nakatulog ng asawa ko, around 2am gising pa din kami, then nung nakakatulog na po kami bigla po nanaginip yung asawa ko na bigla akong tinawag with his creepy voice kaya ginising ko sya dahil natakot talaga ako, the next day nag ask ako if may ibang available na room sila para lilipat sana kami, meron available but sabi nila we need to pay full price again so yung bayad namin sa 2nd night voided na, hinayaan nalang po namin and inintindi if ganon po ang rule nila, 2nd night nakatulog naman kami dahil sguro sa puyat
translated_content: Hi, just wanna share our story here at Elyu Bakasyunan, 3 days before our trip we booked a house in a kubo for 2 nights because that was the only one available at that time, the place is nice, has its own parking, they are quiet and kind, sister We checked in around 7pm then settled the balance, it was late because we had just come from manila, our first night the place was really quiet as if we were the only people, until we couldn't sleep because we felt different , it's creepy, my husband and I couldn't sleep, around 2am we were still awake, then when we were sleeping, my husband suddenly dreamed that he called me with his creepy voice so I woke him up because I was really scared, the next that day I asked if they had another available room so we could move, there was one available but they said we need to pay full price again so our payment for the 2nd night was already voided, we just let it go and understood if that was their rule , 2nd night we fell asleep because we were up late
cleaned_data: hi wanna share story elyu bakasyunan 3 day trip booked house kubo 2 night one available time place nice parking quiet kind sister checked around 7pm settled balance late come manila first night place really quiet people couldnt sleep felt different creepy husband couldnt sleep around 2am still awake sleeping husband suddenly dreamed called creepy voice woke really scared next day asked another available room could move one available said need pay full price payment 2nd night already voided let go understood rule 2nd night fell asleep late

Contents:
OUTSTANDING! Everything about Gefseis Greek Grill was fantastic.

We sent a message through Facebook to inquire if we could bring our small dog with us for a late lunch and the message was answered immediately - thank you!

The setting for the restaurant was fabulous, great decor and pleasant staff dressed in authentic Greek uniforms. The staff were knowledgeable and informative and the food was delicious, so much so in fact we ordered more for take out. We had 3 different styles of pita dips, all very tasty and fresh, the tuna steak was perfectly cooked, the chicken kebab was excellent and the grilled lamb rack was to die for.

The ambience was tranquil and the setting was breathtaking, watching the waves crashing in on the beach behind and the surfers doing their thing. The only thing I would note is the staff, although pleasant, could be a little friendlier.

Overall, this is a fantastic restaurant, not the cheapest, but you certainly pay for what you get and we would absolutely recommend this fine restaurant as the best in the San Juan/San Fernando area. Superb - thank you! We will be back next time we travel to La Union.

OUTSTANDING! Everything about Gefseis Greek Grill was fantastic.

We sent a message through Facebook to inquire if we could bring our small dog with us for a late lunch and the message was answered immediately - thank you!

The staff were knowledgeable and informative and the food was delicious, so much so in fact we ordered more for take out. We had 3 different styles of pita dips, all very tasty and fresh, the tuna steak was perfectly cooked, the chicken kebab was excellent and the grilled lamb rack was to die for.

The ambience was tranquil and the setting was breathtaking, watching the waves crashing in on the beach behind and the surfers doing their thing. The only thing I would note is the staff, although pleasant, could be a little friendlier.

Overall, this is a fantastic restaurant, not the cheapest, but you certainly pay for what you get and we would absolutely recommend this fine restaurant as the best in the San Juan/San Fernando area. Superb - thank you! We will be back next time we travel to La Union.

Common cr are very clean and the water is very strong even in the outdoor shower the water is also strong. The parking lot is wide so you don't have to park outside the place. Over all, we really enjoyed our stay here! Very affordable and very close to the places you want to go.

Contents: Had our wedding at AWESOME HOTEL. NOT RECOMMENDABLE. They had increase there rates ( wedding package and room rates) without informing us beforehand even though we had meeting prior to the event. Rates from their website are not updated. The money making scheme is audacious. They have 10% discount for room rates as part of a complimentary for the wedding but will charge a "premium pricing" as additional for weekends and special events (the irony). They have in house rules such as "no bringing of food and drinks from outside", and would charge corkage fees even if its eaten within the corners of the room you booked including the amenities and during the event itself.

Contents: I had a bad experience yesterday, I was so craving for coffee and grilled cheese. So me and my family go there so that I can have my favorite breakfast there I visited El union coffee 4 years ago and I always love the way they treat customers and how good they're food taste, I'm very excited going I wake up around 8am and I hurry going to the establishment cause I know they always have a line, but I'm with my mom so I don't need to fall in line cause she is a pwd plus she also craves for it. So I go infront and asking if do you still honor pwds cause it was a long time ago so I wanna know before I fall in line so that i know if I do still need to fall in line, the guy that I asked was very accommodating he is wearing white shirt and he has a white hair color like a blonde one he was kind and very welcoming but the personnel who takes orders and money is very not welcoming!!! I was so mad cause I worked in hospitality industry and I never approached my customers the way he did like he was not screaming to the question but his eyes and his body language speaks alot. And I can do tell cause the people around me in the counter was also afraid or maybe pissed off but they don't show it cause they just want the food like me, the cashier employee to make it more precise I think he is gay so that you can recognize him because I see him fixing the pride flag at the counter the rainbow flag that represents LGBT community, then they gave me my coffee and it was okay but I forgot the lid and I DONT WANT TO COME BACK ANYMORE I told my mom to get a lid for me and this gay employee said your daughter didn't requested for a lid so we didn't give her if you want a lid it costs 10 peso my mom bought a lid cause I need it. It was such a terrible experience, one thing I learned about business is that your loyal customer is a walking advertisement and she having a bad experience and it will be remembered for a lifetime so it's either you fix it or you just ignore. It's either you maintain or improve your business. I hope this means a lot cause I don't want someone to experience what I have experienced yesterday and I will SURELY NOT COME BACK ANYMORE EVEN THE FOOD IS TO DIE FOR, I'd rather look for a new and unestablished coffee shop that wants my money and presence than a very known coffee shop but the employees doesn't value its own customers, doesn't know work ethics and don't even respects the people around them so sad for this business, Enjoy it while it lasts nothing lasts forever if you don't know how to manage people.

Contents:
This is a place worth coming back to. Details of the rooms, bathrooms, and even the smallest things like the kind of handsoaps provided were meticulously planned. They have a rooftop where you can chill and watch the sunset.
Location is very accessible to everything you need.
Restos, burger joints, convenience stores and the beach are just a few minutes walk away.
Only downside is the limited parking, so if you're coming in groups, it is best to carpool. Also just walking distance from 7/11 Sebay if you use public transpo.
Place is also pet-friendly. Billie will be very happy to welcome you at Shorebreak!

This is a place worth coming back to. Details of the rooms, bathrooms, and even the smallest things like the kind of handsoaps provided were meticulously planned. They have a rooftop where you can chill and watch the sunset.

Restaurants, burger joints, convenience stores and the beach are just a few minutes walk away.
Only downside is the limited parking, so if you're coming in groups, it's best to carpool. Also just walking distance from 7/11 Sebay if you use public transport.
Place is also pet-friendly. Billie will be very happy to welcome you at Shorebreak!

Contents:
The staffs are friendly and very accommodating. The food serving is decent and reasonable for its price. 

However, upon booking we originally asked for a queen sized bed and a bunk bed so after we made a down payment they told us that the room we asked for is unavailable and the available room is only two bunk beds so good thing IÆm traveling with friends so we can just adjust. I just could not imagine if someone travels with family, a partner and kids perhaps. The room that we got only had two outlets for charging and It is located at the upper bunk bed which is not well thought out electrical planning. The WiFi inside our room is weak and is only accessible outside our door so you if youÆre planning to rest all day while binge watching a show on YouTube or Netflix it wouldnÆt be possible. In our case, my friend works as a VA and the other one is also a student who have to do some important meetings and we have to stay in their restaurant/breakfast area so we can connect to a stronger internet connection. There was an unannounced power outage during our stay and it so happened in the midst of us eating dinner. We were in a middle of a boodle fight and we were provided by a candle light. They donÆt have an electric generator for a back up in case unexpected things like this happen. We went outside to look for cafeÆs since my friend still has to start her shift in a few hours and good thing the power came back just before she clocked in at work.

Overall, It is 2/5 stars for me and my friends just because I was hoping that they should up their game knowing theyÆre still starting their business.

I just couldn't imagine if someone travels with family, a partner and kids perhaps.
